claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: The image shows the title of an original article comparing recombinant and standard-dose influenza vaccines in adults under 65, followed by author names and the beginning of the abstract/background section. The visible text notes that trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines. The image does not present any data or statements about a broader immune response or cross-protection in mismatch seasons, so it does not support the claim. Note: Only the title and the first line of the abstract/background are visible; additional relevant data may be present in other parts of the document not shown.
